content:
Art. 4.154. 
Charging of gifts Gifts 
made by the donor or testator are charged, as the case may be, against the overall reserve of the heirs subject to the reserve or against the available portion, in the order in which they were made, starting with the earliest. Legacies are deducted from the date on which the succession is opened.
Gifts that can be carried forward made to a reserving heir are deducted from the overall reserve of the reserving heirs and, subsidiarily, from the available portion. Any excess is subject to reduction.
Gifts made with dispensation of payment to a reserved heir, as well as gifts to a beneficiary who is not a reserved heir, are deducted from the available share. The excess is subject to reduction.
